info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 10:42PM EDT until March 26 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following river and location in Indiana...
White River at Petersburg.
.Twenty-four precipitation estimates ending at 9 PM EDT this evening show up to 1.10 inches of rain fell in south central Indiana and up to 1.20 inches in southwest central Indiana (Knox County). Lowland flooding is predicted to begin Monday morning in the Petersburg area along the White River in southwest Indiana. This flooding is expected to continue until late Tuesday night.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Petersburg.
* WHEN...From Monday morning to Wednesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding affects low agricultural lands, low oil fields and closes Bottoms Rd...Brothers Rd and East Governors Road in Knox County. In agricultural season...farmers are concerned at this stage.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EDT Sunday /8:45 PM CDT Sunday/ the stage was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 16.7 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 200 PM EDT /100 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Gibson, IN; Knox, IN; Pike, IN
